summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about thriving relationships from Pastor Travis Hearn! In this powerful sermon, PT walks us through the three stages of relationships: the honeymoon stage, the 'party's over' stage, and mature love. Using wisdom from Scripture and personal experiences, he breaks down five key principles for building strong, God-centered relationships. Pastor Travis humorously shares that relationships are like learning a foreign language - we're constantly trying to understand each other! The key? Making God the centerpiece, honoring one another, protecting each other's hearts, communicating lovingly, and being willing to compromise. Can you imagine how different our relationships would be if we truly applied these Biblical principles? PT reminds us that love isn't just a feeling, but a choice we make daily to put the other person first. Whether you're single, dating, or married, this sermon offers practical wisdom for creating thriving, Christ-centered relationships.
mainPoints: God must be the centerpiece of your relationship
Honor and protect your partner's heart
Learn to communicate lovingly and listen effectively

versesMentioned.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails.
Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?
Whoever does not love does not know God, because God is love.
Unless the Lord builds the house, its builders labor in vain.
However, each one of you also must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband.
My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.
Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.
Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for one's friends.

Monday.scripture: Ephesians 4:2-3: 'Be completely humble and gentle; be patient, bearing with one another in love. Make every effort to keep the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace.'
Monday.action: Identify one relationship where you struggle with patience. Write down three specific ways you can show more grace and understanding this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me to see others through Your eyes of love. Give me patience, humility, and the ability to extend grace, just as You have graciously loved me. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 31:10-11: 'A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies. Her husband has full confidence in her and lacks nothing of value.'
Tuesday.action: Make a list of your partner's (or potential partner's) strengths. Commit to verbally affirming these qualities to them or to yourself this week.
Tuesday.prayer: God, teach me to honor and respect those closest to me. Help me see the value in my relationships and appreciate the unique qualities of those around me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:8: 'Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins.'
Wednesday.action: Identify a past hurt in a relationship. Spend time praying about it and ask God to help you truly forgive and move forward.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, give me a heart of forgiveness. Help me to love deeply and let go of past hurts, just as You have forgiven me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Colossians 3:13: 'Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.'
Thursday.action: Practice active listening in one conversation today. Focus on understanding the other person completely before responding.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me to listen more and speak less. Give me wisdom to communicate with love, patience, and understanding. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 2:3-4: 'Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.'
Friday.action: Do something unexpected and sacrificial for someone in your life. Put their needs ahead of your own, without expecting anything in return.
Friday.prayer: God, teach me the true meaning of love - selfless, sacrificial, and unconditional. Help me to serve others as Jesus would. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Ecclesiastes 4:9-10: 'Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their labor: If either of them falls down, one can help the other up.'
Saturday.action: Reach out to a friend or family member who might be struggling. Offer genuine support, prayer, or practical help.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, show me how to be a supportive and encouraging presence in the lives of those around me. Help me to be a vessel of Your love and compassion. Amen.
